intro: Siphocampylus ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and thrives in partial shade. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers appear in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Siphocampylus ferrugineus is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
